clinical_study.brief_title: Effectivity and Safety of Ultrasound-guided Percutaneously Laser Ablation for Refractory Neoplasms

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of ultrasonography (US) -guided laser ablation liver, kidney, pancreas, lung and retroperitoneal tumors, the investigators used preoperative and postoperative US/CEUS/CT/MRI to assess lesions, and laboratory tests including the tumor markers to evaluate the general condition of patients. Intraoperative US/CEUS/CT would be applied to monitor ablation lesions.

primary_outcome.measure: 100 patients of refractory neoplasms with image-guided laser ablation-related effectivity as assessed by MRI

arm_group.arm_group_label: US-guided laser ablation for refractory neoplasms
arm_group.description: The investigators used percutaneously US-guided laser ablation for patients with small hepatocellular carcinoma (single or multiple nodules of less than 3 cm in diameter), Child-Pugh A/B, PLT ≥ 50*10E9/L and PT ≤ 20s. Then the investigators estimated the safety and efficacy of this treatment through follow-up of US/CEUS/CT/MRI and the tumor markers every three months.

intervention.intervention_name: US-guided laser ablation for refractory neoplasms
intervention.arm_group_label: US-guided laser ablation for refractory neoplasms

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with small hepatocellular carcinoma (single or multiple nodules of less than 3 cm in diameter),
- Patients with Child-Pugh A/B,
- Patients with PLT ≥ 50*10E9/L and PT ≤ 20s.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with blood coagulation dysfunction, ChildPugh ≥3, severe cardiopulmonary disease, intolerant anesthesia and upper gastrointestinal bleeding in shock.
